sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些副词均有"确实地，真正地"之意。
means: indeed ： 一般用于肯定或证实对方所说的话，多承接前言，也用来加强或肯定自己说话的语气。
really ： 主要用于强调与事实或现实不相违背，也可表示不快、惊奇或某种含蓄的怀疑。
truly ： 强调客观存在的真实性，没有任何虚假。
actually ： 侧重于实际的事，而不是凭空想象或推测的事。

sentence.Network_en: Issues such as these were not really his concern.
sentence.Network_cn: 他其实并不关心诸如此类的问题。

sentence.Network_en: I don't see the point in it really. It's just stupid.
sentence.Network_cn: 我真的不理解这到底有什么意义，简直是愚蠢透顶。

sentence.Network_en: "You really won't tell?" she asked, begging for reassurance.
sentence.Network_cn: “你真的不说吗？”她问道，乞求得到安慰。

jx.jx_en_mean: used to emphasize the sincerity of a statement or opinion
jx.jx_cn_mean: 果真，的的确确，千真万确

lj.lj_ly: I sometimes wonder whether you really and truly love me.
lj.lj_ls: 我有时候想你是否果真爱我。

encyclopedia.content: 简介 REALLY元利科技专业从事流体控制产品的研发与制造，并具有进出口权的高新技术企业。在自主研发和生产气动增压泵、气动同轴阀、气动推拉器及各类控制系统设计和集成过程中，成为德国盖米GEMUE、美国ASCO-NUMATICS、美国BARKSDALE等著名品牌的一级代理商， 这三个品牌分别代表了流体、气动、控制领域的先进技术和高端品质。 通过多年流体控制的技术积累和对相关行业的深入研究，采用自主研发产品与高端代理品牌相结合方式，该

entry.def: You can use really to emphasize a statement.

example.ex: I'm very sorry. I really am...
example.tran: 我很抱歉。真的。

example.ex: It really is best to manage without any medication if you possibly can...
example.tran: 如果你不服用任何药物就能挺过去的话，最好不过了。

entry.tran: （放在形容词或副词前表示强调）极其，非常
entry.def: You can use really to emphasize an adjective or adverb.

example.ex: It was really good...
example.tran: 好极了。

example.ex: They were really nice people...
example.tran: 他们是极好的人。

entry.def: You use really when you are discussing the real facts about something, in contrast to the ones someone wants you to believe.

example.ex: My father didn't really love her...
example.tran: 我父亲实际上并不爱她。

example.ex: What was really going on?...
example.tran: 到底怎么了？

entry.tran: （用于问句或否定句中引出否定回答）真的，说实在的
entry.def: People use really in questions and negative statements when they want you to answer 'no'.

example.ex: Do you really think he would be that stupid?...
example.tran: 你真的认为他会那么蠢吗？

example.ex: You can't really expect me to believe you didn't know him.
example.tran: 你不会真的觉得我会相信你不认识他吧。

entry.def: If you refer to a time when something really begins to happen, you are emphasizing that it starts to happen at that time to a much greater extent and much more seriously than before.

example.ex: That's when the pressure really started...
example.tran: 那就是真正开始有压力的时候。

example.ex: He only really started going out with girls at college.
example.tran: 他上大学的时候才真正开始和女孩子约会。

entry.tran: （放在否定陈述句中减轻语气）真的，真正，其实
entry.def: People sometimes use really to slightly reduce the force of a negative statement.

example.ex: I'm not really surprised...
example.tran: 我其实并不惊讶。

example.ex: 'Did they hurt you?' — 'Not really'...
example.tran: “他们伤害你了吗？”“其实并没有。”

entry.tran: （放在句中表示不那么确定）真的，还是
entry.def: People sometimes add really to statements in order to make them less definite and more uncertain.

example.ex: She is a quiet girl really...
example.tran: 她算得上是个蛮安静的女孩。

example.ex: I'm happy most of the time, really.
example.tran: 我多数时候还是挺快乐的。

entry.def: People use really to show that they are surprised or that the person they are speaking to may be surprised about something.

example.ex: Actually it was quite good really...
example.tran: 事实上那还真的不错呢。

example.ex: I was really rather fond of Arthur.
example.tran: 我还真的很喜欢阿瑟。

entry.tran: （对某人所说的话表示怀疑或不相信）真的，是吗
entry.def: You can say really to express surprise or disbelief at what someone has said.

example.ex: 'We discovered it was totally the wrong decision.' — 'Really?'...
example.tran: “我们发现那完全是个错误的决定。”——“真的吗？”

example.ex: 'We saw a very bright shooting star.'—'Did you really?'
example.tran: “我们看到了一颗很明亮的流星。”——“真的吗？”

entry.tran: （用在对话中表示对对方所说的内容感兴趣）是吗，真的吗
entry.def: You can say 'really' in a conversation to show that you are interested in what someone is saying.

example.ex: 'We had a very interesting chat.' — 'Really? About what?'
example.tran: “我们相谈甚欢。”——“是吗？谈了些什么？”

entry.tran: （表示有些恼怒或厌烦）说真的，坦白讲
entry.def: Some people say really when they are slightly annoyed or offended by something.

example.ex: Really, Mr Riss, I expected better of you.
example.tran: 坦白讲，里斯先生，我没想到你会那样。

means.word_mean: 1. in accordance with truth or fact or reality;

sentences.sentence: "to be nominally but not actually independent"
"large meteorites actually come from the asteroid belt"

means.word_mean: 3. in fact (used as intensifiers or sentence modifiers);

sentences.sentence: "in truth, moral decay hastened the decline of the Roman Empire"

means.word_mean: 4. used as intensifiers; `real' is sometimes used informally for `really'; `rattling' is informal;

auth_sentence.content: It doesn't really change what I'm doing.
auth_sentence.res_content: It doesn't really change what I'm doing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It doesn't really change what I'm doing.

auth_sentence.content: Is it really time to throw the traditions away?
auth_sentence.res_content: Is it really time to throw the traditions away?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Is it really time to throw the traditions away?

auth_sentence.content: This has been a really remarkable period of time.
auth_sentence.res_content: This has been a really remarkable period of time.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This has been a really remarkable period of time.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 真的, 真实的, 不动产的
stems_affixes.word_buile: real真实,现实→adj.真的, 真实的, 不动产的
realist[n.现实主义者]+ic……的→adj.现实[主义]的
un不+real真实,现实→adj.不真实的, 虚幻的
real真实,现实+ly表副词→adv.真正地, 实在地
real真实,现实+ism主义→realism现实主义
real真实,现实+ist人→n.现实主义者

stems_affixes.value_cn: 真实, 事实, 本体, 逼真
stems_affixes.word_buile: real真实,现实+ity表名词→n.真实, 事实, 本体, 逼真

stems_affixes.value_cn: 认识到, 了解, 实现, 实行
stems_affixes.word_buile: real真实,现实+ize表动词→v.认识到, 了解, 实现, 实行

means.word_mean: 真正地; 确实地; 实际上

sentences.en: Really, that was a terrible mistake.
sentences.cn: 说真的, 那是非常严重的错误。

sentences.en: I see you worrying on my account, but really I don't mind.
sentences.cn: 我看得出你在为我着急, 但其实我并不在意。

sentences.en: I didn't really mean to hurt you.
sentences.cn: 我真的不是存心得罪你的。

jushi.english: How can we seek out a really good person for the job?
jushi.chinese: 我们怎样才能找到一个真正适当的人来做这件工作?

jushi.english: Is it really necessary for me to attend the meeting?
jushi.chinese: 我真的必须出席会议吗?

jushi.english: I really felt for her when her husband died.
jushi.chinese: 她丈夫死了,我非常同情她。
